page.title: 10HARLESTON HALL
page.content: Harleston Hall is owned by the Phoenix family,and has been since 1919. The family originally came from Lincolnshire and Cambridgeshire and have always been farmers.They own a lot of the surrounding farmland. The Hall was built in the 1200's and served as a Manor House.It was refaced with plaster in 1832.The out-buildings were constructed in 1879.The buildings cover 2-3 acres of land surrounding the Hall. The farmland covers over 400 acres of land altogether.This land is mainly used for arable farming.No fruit is grown on the farm,but there is a reasonably sized vegetable garden which provides the families needs. Apart from sending pigs to Haverhill the Phoenix brothers sell their corn to customers in the East-Anglian region. Eggs and potatoes are also sold.
